note.p: Birth: Loug hrea, County Galway, Ireland (03 August 1829)
Education: France, Guernsey, Dublin. BA (1850, Dublin), MA (1870)

Career: Staff, Geological Survey of Ireland (1851); transferred to the Geological Survey of England (1853); joined Geological Survey of India; Professor of Geology, Roorkee College (1854-1862); served as a volunteer during the Indian Mutiny; Superintendent of the Geological Survey of India (by 1876); retired to England (1887); died of heart failure
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series B 1907 vol 79 pp xix-xxvi by William T Blanford
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
Notes: Citation 2 is list of publications from Cert X, 303i
